column4: Looks like i am not the only one with wifi issues, i have a Atheros AR242x card that for the life of me, i can not get working, have tried back ports, madwifi, ndiswrapper, and other things... not sure if i am doing something or what, Looks as if my card might be disabled... but no idea how to enable it. http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/113426/
that device should work fine.. you say you've tried the backports..
I doesn't, on a fresh install, did the blacklisting, disabling, rebooted, installed backports, then rebooted again and still no wifi.
are you using 64bit/
are you using 8.10, or 8.04
should be unnecessary.. it works w/ a patched version of madwifi under 8.04.. but it should work just by installing the backports under Intrepid. (8.10
go to system/admin/hardware drivers
what is there.. "Support for Atheros 802.11 wireless lan cards"
if you don't have two options there for that atheros device, you've nto followed instructions properly
again, what does that option say there..
you're doing something wrong... you should also have there.. "Support for 5xxxx series of Atheros 802.11 wireless LAN cards"
you say you've tried the backports... what did you try
i've tried to ask you, and you left before i had the chance
ok, are both of them enabled, or both disabled, or what?
i thought you said there were two, and it was disabled?
yes
so you installed the backports, ...and disabled support for athoers 802.11.. cards" right?
open a terminal, what is the output of lsb_release -a
i honestly don't know.. you've probably done something in your fumbling to get this working.. but those instructions you were looking at, should work perfectly
what model is your laptop?
i'm really not sure what all you've done, but those instructions should work perfectly
i've got that device on 3 different laptops, not to mention i've set it up on several others.. and thats exactly what i've done (what those instructions say)
that device was harder in 8.04 than in 8.10
maybe you should try a shotgun...
